title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 603.29 - Champerty and maintenance
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 603.29 - Champerty and maintenance

State Regulations

No attorney shall by himself, or by or in the name of
another person, either before or after action brought, promise, give, or
procure, or permit to be promised or given any valuable consideration to any
person as an inducement to placing in his hands, or in the hands of another
person, any claim for the purpose of making a claim or bringing an action or
special proceeding thereon, or defending the same; nor shall any attorney, directly or indirectly, as a consideration for such retainer, pay any expenses
attending the prosecution or defense of any such claim or action. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
603.29

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
